content:
TITLE: Installing and Setting Up Monday Apps CLI Tool
DESCRIPTION: Commands for installing the monday apps CLI tool, initializing a project with a personal token, and creating a tunnel for local development.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mondaycom/welcome-apps.git/blob/master/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
npm i -g @mondaycom/apps-cli
```

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
mapps init -t <your-personal-token>
```

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
mapps tunnel:create
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Initializing Monday Apps CLI
DESCRIPTION: Command to initialize the Monday apps CLI with your account's API token.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mondaycom/welcome-apps.git/blob/master/apps/github-monday-code/SETUP.md#2025-04-21_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
mapps init
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Deploying Code to Monday Platform
DESCRIPTION: Command to deploy the app code to the monday platform using the mapps CLI tool.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mondaycom/welcome-apps.git/blob/master/apps/quickstart-integrations-monday-code/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
mapps code:push
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Deploying Monday App to Monday Code
DESCRIPTION: Command to deploy the app to Monday Code. The process involves choosing the associated app and draft version to deploy.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mondaycom/welcome-apps.git/blob/master/apps/github-monday-code/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
$ npm run deploy
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Deploying App to Monday Code Hosting
DESCRIPTION: Command to push and deploy the app to Monday's code hosting service.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mondaycom/welcome-apps.git/blob/master/apps/github-monday-code/SETUP.md#2025-04-21_snippet_5

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
mapps code:push
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Deploying Monday App to Monday Code Hosting
DESCRIPTION: Command to deploy the Monday app to Monday code hosting. This will initiate the deployment process, allowing you to select your app and the draft version to deploy.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mondaycom/welcome-apps.git/blob/master/apps/quickstart-fullstack-react-node/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
npm run deploy
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring Environment Variables for Monday.com and Slack Integration
DESCRIPTION: Environment variable configuration containing client ID, client secret, and other OAuth credentials needed for the Slack integration with Monday.com
SOURCE: https://github.com/mondaycom/welcome-apps.git/blob/master/apps/slack-node/SETUP.md#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: env
CODE:
```
SLACK_CLIENT_ID=your_client_id_here
SLACK_CLIENT_SECRET=your_client_secret_here
MONDAY_SIGNING_SECRET=your_signing_secret_here
SERVER_URL=your_server_url_here
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Initializing Monday Code for First-Time Deployment
DESCRIPTION: Command to initialize Monday code for the first-time deployment. Prompts for a Monday access token which can be obtained from the Developer section > My access tokens.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mondaycom/welcome-apps.git/blob/master/apps/github-monday-code/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
$ npm run mapps:init
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Creating a Tunnel for Local Development
DESCRIPTION: Command to create an ngrok tunnel to expose the local development server to the internet for testing.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mondaycom/welcome-apps.git/blob/master/apps/quickstart-integrations-monday-code/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_5

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
ngrok http 8080
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Downloading the Quickstart Template using npx
DESCRIPTION: Command to download the monday code quickstart integration template from the official GitHub repository.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mondaycom/welcome-apps.git/blob/master/apps/quickstart-integrations-monday-code/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
npx degit github:mondaycom/welcome-apps/apps/quickstart-integrations-monday-code
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Setting Environment Secrets
DESCRIPTION: Command to set environment secrets for the deployed application.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mondaycom/welcome-apps.git/blob/master/apps/github-monday-code/SETUP.md#2025-04-21_snippet_6

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
mapps code:secret
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing Monday Apps CLI Globally
DESCRIPTION: Command to install the Monday apps-cli package globally, enabling access to Monday app development tools from any location in the terminal.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mondaycom/welcome-apps.git/blob/master/apps/github-monday-code/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_6

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
$ npm i -g @mondaycom/apps-cli
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Running Monday App in Development Mode with Ngrok Tunnel
DESCRIPTION: Command to build the client code and run the server with an ngrok tunnel for local development. This allows you to test your Monday app with a public URL.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mondaycom/welcome-apps.git/blob/master/apps/quickstart-fullstack-react-node/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
npm run dev-server
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Starting the Monday App with Ngrok Tunnel
DESCRIPTION: Command to start the local server with an ngrok tunnel, which creates a public URL for the locally running app to enable Monday.com to communicate with it.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mondaycom/welcome-apps.git/blob/master/apps/quickstart-integrations-ts/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
$ npm start
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Starting Local Development Server
DESCRIPTION: Command to start the app server locally for development purposes on port 8080.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mondaycom/welcome-apps.git/blob/master/apps/quickstart-integrations-monday-code/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
npm run dev
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Starting the Monday.com Docs Viewer App with Automatic Tunnel
DESCRIPTION: Command to run the application with an automatic virtual tunnel. This will provide a tunnel URL that will be used in the Monday.com app configuration.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mondaycom/welcome-apps.git/blob/master/apps/docs-viewer/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
npm start
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Starting Monday.com App Development Server
DESCRIPTION: Command to start the development server with Monday tunnel for local testing
SOURCE: https://github.com/mondaycom/welcome-apps.git/blob/master/apps/quickstart-react/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
npm start
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Starting Development Server
DESCRIPTION: Command to start the application with automatic ngrok tunnel for local development.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mondaycom/welcome-apps.git/blob/master/apps/word-cloud/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
npm start
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Running Development Server with Monday Tunnel
DESCRIPTION: Command to start the development server using Monday.com tunnel for local development and testing
SOURCE: https://github.com/mondaycom/welcome-apps.git/blob/master/apps/quickstart-integrations/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
$ npm run dev
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Running the Monday.com React App with Tunnel
DESCRIPTION: Command to start the Monday.com application in development mode with the Monday tunnel. This makes the app available for local testing and development.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mondaycom/welcome-apps.git/blob/master/apps/quickstart-fullstack-react-node/client/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
npm run dev
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Cloning Monday.com Welcome Apps Repository
DESCRIPTION: Command to clone the welcome-apps repository from Monday.com's Github.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mondaycom/welcome-apps.git/blob/master/apps/github-monday-code/SETUP.md#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: git
CODE:
```
git clone https://github.com/mondaycom/welcome-apps
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Starting the Monday App Server
DESCRIPTION: This command starts the server for the Monday app, making it ready to handle requests and integrate with Slack and Monday.com.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mondaycom/welcome-apps.git/blob/master/apps/slack-node/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
$ npm start
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Starting the Application Server
DESCRIPTION: Command to start the Node.js application server for the Monday.com Github integration app.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mondaycom/welcome-apps.git/blob/master/apps/github-node/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
$ npm start
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Starting the Development Server
DESCRIPTION: Command to start the local development server for the monday.com app.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mondaycom/welcome-apps.git/blob/master/apps/jira-node/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
$ npm run start
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Viewing Server Logs for Deployed Monday App
DESCRIPTION: Command to view server logs for the deployed Monday app when using Monday logger.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mondaycom/welcome-apps.git/blob/master/apps/github-monday-code/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_5

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
$ npm run logs
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Starting Development Server
DESCRIPTION: NPM command to start the local development server.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mondaycom/welcome-apps.git/blob/master/apps/github-monday-code/SETUP.md#2025-04-21_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
npm run dev
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Starting the Monday App Development Server
DESCRIPTION: Command to start the development server for the Monday app project using npm.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mondaycom/welcome-apps.git/blob/master/apps/onboarding-example/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
npm run start
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Setting Environment Variables for the Monday App
DESCRIPTION: Command to set the signing secret environment variable required for authentication between monday and your app.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mondaycom/welcome-apps.git/blob/master/apps/quickstart-integrations-monday-code/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
mapps code:env -m set -k MONDAY_SIGNING_SECRET -v <your_signing_secret> -i <your app id>
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Running the Workspace View App
DESCRIPTION: Command to start the development server for the workspace view application.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mondaycom/welcome-apps.git/blob/master/apps/workspace-view-app/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
npm run start
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Running Monday App in Development Mode
DESCRIPTION: Command to start the Monday app server in development mode for local testing and development.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mondaycom/welcome-apps.git/blob/master/apps/github-monday-code/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
$ npm run dev
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Building Monday.com App for Production
DESCRIPTION: Command to create a production build of the Monday.com app for deployment
SOURCE: https://github.com/mondaycom/welcome-apps.git/blob/master/apps/quickstart-react/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
npm run build
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Building for Production
DESCRIPTION: Command to create a production build of the application for deployment.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mondaycom/welcome-apps.git/blob/master/apps/word-cloud/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
npm run build
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Building the Monday.com Docs Viewer App for Release
DESCRIPTION: Command to create a production build of the app that can be uploaded to Monday.com for release.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mondaycom/welcome-apps.git/blob/master/apps/docs-viewer/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
npm run build
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing Dependencies with NPM for Monday App
DESCRIPTION: Command to install all required dependencies for the Monday app using npm. This is a necessary step before running the application locally.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mondaycom/welcome-apps.git/blob/master/apps/quickstart-fullstack-react-node/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
npm install
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing Dependencies with NPM
DESCRIPTION: Command to install the required Node.js dependencies for the Monday.com integration app
SOURCE: https://github.com/mondaycom/welcome-apps.git/blob/master/apps/quickstart-integrations/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
$ npm install
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing Dependencies with Yarn for Monday App
DESCRIPTION: Command to install all the required dependencies for the Monday Quickstart Integration app using Yarn package manager.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mondaycom/welcome-apps.git/blob/master/apps/quickstart-integrations-ts/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
$ yarn install
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing Dependencies for Monday.com Docs Viewer App
DESCRIPTION: Command to install all required dependencies for the Docs Viewer example app before running it.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mondaycom/welcome-apps.git/blob/master/apps/docs-viewer/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
npm install
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing Dependencies for Workspace View App
DESCRIPTION: Commands to install the necessary dependencies and set the Node.js version using NVM for the workspace view application.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mondaycom/welcome-apps.git/blob/master/apps/workspace-view-app/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
npm install
nvm use
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing Node Dependencies for Monday.com App
DESCRIPTION: Command to install all required node modules and dependencies for the Monday.com app
SOURCE: https://github.com/mondaycom/welcome-apps.git/blob/master/apps/quickstart-react/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
npm install
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing Node Dependencies
DESCRIPTION: Command to install required node modules for the application.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mondaycom/welcome-apps.git/blob/master/apps/jira-node/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
$ npm install
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing Dependencies for Monday.com React App
DESCRIPTION: Command to install all required npm packages for the Monday.com Quickstart React app. This should be run in the project directory before starting the application.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mondaycom/welcome-apps.git/blob/master/apps/quickstart-fullstack-react-node/client/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
npm install
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing Node Modules for Monday App
DESCRIPTION: This command installs all the necessary Node.js dependencies for the Monday app project as specified in the package.json file.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mondaycom/welcome-apps.git/blob/master/apps/slack-node/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
$ npm install
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing Node Dependencies
DESCRIPTION: Command to install all required npm dependencies for the project.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mondaycom/welcome-apps.git/blob/master/apps/word-cloud/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
npm install
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing Node Dependencies
DESCRIPTION: Command to install all required Node.js dependencies using npm package manager.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mondaycom/welcome-apps.git/blob/master/apps/github-node/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
$ npm install
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing Dependencies for Monday App
DESCRIPTION: Command to install the necessary dependencies for the Monday app project using npm.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mondaycom/welcome-apps.git/blob/master/apps/onboarding-example/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
npm install
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing Node Dependencies for Monday App
DESCRIPTION: Command to install all required Node.js dependencies specified in the package.json file for the Monday app.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mondaycom/welcome-apps.git/blob/master/apps/github-monday-code/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
$ npm install
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing Project Dependencies
DESCRIPTION: NPM command to install the required project dependencies.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mondaycom/welcome-apps.git/blob/master/apps/github-monday-code/SETUP.md#2025-04-21_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
npm install
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Setting Node Version with NVM
DESCRIPTION: Command to set the correct Node.js version using Node Version Manager (NVM). Requires NVM to be installed on the system.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mondaycom/welcome-apps.git/blob/master/apps/github-node/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
$ nvm use
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Setting Node Version for Monday CLI
DESCRIPTION: Command to set the correct Node.js version using nvm for running the monday CLI. Requires Node.js 18+.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mondaycom/welcome-apps.git/blob/master/apps/jira-node/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
$ nvm use
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Selecting Node Version with NVM for Monday App
DESCRIPTION: This command uses NVM (Node Version Manager) to select the appropriate Node.js version for the Monday app project as specified in the project's configuration.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mondaycom/welcome-apps.git/blob/master/apps/slack-node/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
$ nvm use
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Using NVM to Set Node Version for Monday App Development
DESCRIPTION: Command to use the correct Node.js version as specified in the project's .nvmrc file for Monday app development.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mondaycom/welcome-apps.git/blob/master/apps/github-monday-code/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
$ nvm use
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Changing to Project Directory
DESCRIPTION: Command to navigate to the downloaded quickstart project directory.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mondaycom/welcome-apps.git/blob/master/apps/quickstart-integrations-monday-code/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
cd mondaycode-quickstart
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring Web Crawler Access with robots.txt
DESCRIPTION: This robots.txt configuration allows all web crawlers (User-agent: *) to access the entire website by not specifying any disallowed paths. It includes a reference to the robots.txt protocol documentation.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mondaycom/welcome-apps.git/blob/master/apps/quickstart-react/public/robots.txt#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: robotstxt
CODE:
```
# https://www.robotstxt.org/robotstxt.html
User-agent: *
Disallow:
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring Robot.txt for Full Access
DESCRIPTION: This snippet configures the robot.txt file to allow all user agents full access to the website. It doesn't disallow any paths, effectively giving search engine bots unrestricted crawling permissions.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mondaycom/welcome-apps.git/blob/master/apps/workspace-view-app/public/robots.txt#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: robotstxt
CODE:
```
# https://www.robotstxt.org/robotstxt.html
User-agent: *
Disallow:
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring Default Robot Access Settings in robots.txt
DESCRIPTION: A standard robots.txt configuration that allows all web crawlers (User-agent: *) to access all content on the website by not specifying any disallowed paths (Disallow:).
SOURCE: https://github.com/mondaycom/welcome-apps.git/blob/master/apps/quickstart-fullstack-react-node/client/public/robots.txt#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: robotstxt
CODE:
```
# https://www.robotstxt.org/robotstxt.html
User-agent: *
Disallow:
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring Environment Variables for GitHub OAuth
DESCRIPTION: Example of .env file configuration containing GitHub OAuth client ID and secret credentials needed for the application to authenticate with GitHub.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mondaycom/welcome-apps.git/blob/master/apps/github-node/SETUP.md#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: env
CODE:
```
GITHUB_CLIENT_ID=your_client_id_here
GITHUB_CLIENT_SECRET=your_client_secret_here
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring robots.txt for Full Website Access
DESCRIPTION: This robots.txt configuration allows all user agents to access the entire website. It uses the standard syntax for robots.txt files, specifying no restrictions on crawling.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mondaycom/welcome-apps.git/blob/master/apps/quickstart-workdocs/public/robots.txt#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: robotstxt
CODE:
```
User-agent: *
Disallow:
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring Web Robot Access Permissions in robots.txt
DESCRIPTION: A standard robots.txt configuration that allows all web crawlers to access all parts of the website. This configuration does not place any restrictions on web robots/crawlers.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mondaycom/welcome-apps.git/blob/master/apps/onboarding-example/public/robots.txt#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: robotstxt
CODE:
```
User-agent: *
Disallow:
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Navigating to Project Directory
DESCRIPTION: Command to change directory to the Github Monday code sample app.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mondaycom/welcome-apps.git/blob/master/apps/github-monday-code/SETUP.md#2025-04-21_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
cd apps/github-monday-code
```
